UI_visible_response: Read 18 web pagesView Page DetailsPeng Shuai is a Chinese professional tennis player who made headlines in November 2021 when she accused former Chinese Vice Premier Zhang Gaoli of sexual assault. After making the accusation on Weibo, Peng disappeared from public view for a period of time. This led to widespread international concern for her safety and well-being.In response to her disappearance and the lack of a transparent investigation into her allegations, the Women's Tennis Association (WTA) suspended all its tournaments in China. The WTA demanded a full and fair investigation into Peng's claims. However, after a period of suspension, the WTA resumed its events in China in 2023. Peng herself later denied making any accusations of sexual assault in interviews, though there were concerns that she might not have been speaking freely.Recently, the International Tennis Federation (ITF) announced that the Billie Jean King Cup Finals will be held in Shenzhen, China, from 2025 to 2027. ITF President David Haggerty stated that he had spoken with Peng and was convinced of her safety and well-being. However, the case remains a sensitive issue, with some AI chatbots in China, like DeepSeek, refusing to discuss it.CopyTry AgainShare
traffic_visible_response: Peng Shuai is a Chinese professional tennis player who made headlines in November 2021 when she accused former Chinese Vice Premier Zhang Gaoli of sexual assault[^6^]. After making the accusation on Weibo, Peng disappeared from public view for a period of time[^8^]. This led to widespread international concern for her safety and well-being[^6^].In response to her disappearance and the lack of a transparent investigation into her allegations, the Women's Tennis Association (WTA) suspended all its tournaments in China[^1^]. The WTA demanded a full and fair investigation into Peng's claims[^8^]. However, after a period of suspension, the WTA resumed its events in China in 2023[^9^]. Peng herself later denied making any accusations of sexual assault in interviews, though there were concerns that she might not have been speaking freely[^7^].Recently, the International Tennis Federation (ITF) announced that the Billie Jean King Cup Finals will be held in Shenzhen, China, from 2025 to 2027[^1^]. ITF President David Haggerty stated that he had spoken with Peng and was convinced of her safety and well-being[^1^]. However, the case remains a sensitive issue, with some AI chatbots in China, like DeepSeek, refusing to discuss it[^5^].
